title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી પાંચાળ દેશમાં, કાજુ કારીયાણી ગામ<RHYME_208793>; 
અનંત લીલા ત્યાં કરી, હરિએ કર્યું નિજધામ<RHYME_208793>.
gujarati.context: In a land of five villages, there is a village where the Kaju fruit ripens; there, I performed innumerable acts of playful love under Hari's guidance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેહ ગામમાં જે વસે, નરનારી આદિ જન<RHYME_208794>; 
ભાવાભાવે ભગવાનનાં, સહુને થયાં દર્શન<RHYME_208794>.
gujarati.context: In every village, people gather with all their might; They behold the divine in each other's sight.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સમજુ થયા સતસંગી, અણસમજુ રહ્યા એમ<RHYME_208795>; 
પાપી નરે પરમોદિયાં, તે કુસંગ તજશે કેમ<RHYME_208795>.
gujarati.context: Understanding companionship is a blessing, while misunderstandings can lead to separation; wicked people are punished for their actions, which ultimately leads to disconnection.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પણ દર્શન જેને દયાળનું, તે નિરફળ નવ્ય જાય<RHYME_208796>; 
અંત સમે અવશ્ય આવી, શ્રીહરિ કરે છે સહાય<RHYME_208796>.
gujarati.context: When one's sight is blessed with divine guidance, it remains fruitless and goes nowhere; at the end of life, God grants salvation.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેની વાત સાંભળજ્યો સહુ, થયું જેમ તેમ હવે કહું; 
એક કાઠી કુસંગી અપાર<RHYME_208797>, નામ માણશિયો નિરધાર<RHYME_208797>.
gujarati.context: Please listen to my words carefully, I'll now speak as it is; A single stone can be immense, a nameless one is of no value.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તે તો સાજો શરીરમાં સુખી, લવલેશ દેહ નહિ દુઃખી; 
સહજ સ્વભાવે બેઠોતો બાર<RHYME_208799>, આવ્યા જમ લેવા તેને ચાર<RHYME_208799>.
gujarati.context: True happiness dwells in a contented body and soul, free from pain and distress. One should live naturally, without pretenses, and let go of worldly desires like a tree letting go of its leaves.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ કાળા ને કરૂર વાણી, જેને જોઈ જીવે નહિ પ્રાણી; 
બહુ ભૂખ્યા ભૂંડા ભયંકર<RHYME_208801>, હાથે પાશ પર્સુ હથિયાર<RHYME_208801>.
gujarati.context: A person with extremely black skin and cruel voice is feared by all living beings, who cannot even look at him without dying. He is a ruthless and brutal man, holding a noose in his hand and a weapon on his belt.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
બેઠા બે જણા લોહને ગાડે, બીજા બે જણા બેઠા છે પાડે; 
પછી ગાડે પાડેથી ઊતરી, લીધો કાઠીને કબજે કરી.
gujarati.context: Two people sit on one seat, while two others are standing; then the seated ones get up and take the standing ones' place by force.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
દઈ માર ને મોર્ય લૈ કીધો, જમે એમનો એમ જ લીધો; 
મારે બહુ પાડે બુમરાણ<RHYME_208805>, તોય મેલે નહિ જમરાણ<RHYME_208805>.
gujarati.context: My wealth was taken away from me, and I was left with nothing; but I didn't lose my dignity or pride.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે કુસંગી કેમ તું રહ્યો, તજી સ્વામી અમારો શું થયો; 
જો તું પડ્યો અમારે જ પાને, તો તું સુખ ઇચ્છે હવે શાને.
gujarati.context:
When you're away from us, what has happened to our Lord?
You've fallen at our feet; now you long for happiness when reunited.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
બોલ્યો માણશિયો તેહ વારે, છે સ્વામીજીનું દર્શન મારે; 
બીજું તો મેં કાંઈ નવ કર્યું, કર્યું તેમાં તો આવું નીસર્યું.
gujarati.context: A soulful encounter with the divine has left me transformed, and I've gained a newfound purpose in life.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
હવે કરે તો કરે સ્વામી વાર<RHYME_208810>, તે વિના બીજો નથી આધાર<RHYME_208810>; 
એમ કહેતાં આવ્યા અવિનાશ, જમ મેલી ભાગ્યા પામી ત્રાસ.
gujarati.context: Now is the time to take action, for the Lord's wrath is near and has no alternative; our fate will be decided without hope or rescue.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી આવ્યો માણશિયો ઘેર<RHYME_208811>, કહે નાથે ઉગાર્યો આ વેર<RHYME_208811>; 
એમ કરતાં વીતી ઘડી ચાર<RHYME_208811>, આવ્યા નવ કૃતાંત તે વાર<RHYME_208811>.
gujarati.context: Someone else has arrived at the scene and claims they've settled the score, but it's actually a new drama unfolding; this is not the end of the conflict, there will be more to come.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેણે તરત મારી લીધો મોર<RHYME_208812>, પાડે માણશિયો બહુ બકોર<RHYME_208812>; 
જમ કહે રખે ગામ જગાડે, લઈ જાઈએ એને ઉપરવાડે.
gujarati.context: Someone has taken away my life and left me with nothing but darkness at dawn; they've even ruined the village and will take it all away, leaving none behind.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બીજો કહે જાશું ભાગોળે, એક કહે સંત હશે આગળે; 
એક કહે સંત નથી જો આંહીં, શીદ બીક રાખો મન માંહિ.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that when others will be divided (bhago), one should stay united with the divine, and if not, then keep a quiet mind within.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી લઈ ચાલ્યા ગામ બાર<RHYME_208799>, આવ્યા અલબેલો તેહ વાર<RHYME_208799>; 
કરી રીસ કિંકરને કહ્યું, કેમ ફૂટ્યું છે મૂરખો હૈયું.
gujarati.context: After leaving the village and town, I came to a place where only war existed. They asked me why the fool (myself) was standing there, not knowing what to do.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આ ગામ માંહિ વસે છે જન<RHYME_208794>, જેને છે મારું સંતદર્શન<RHYME_208794>; 
તેને લેવા આવો છો અભાગી, શીદને મોત લિયો છો માગી.
gujarati.context: In this village, there is a saintly person who has my darshan; take him and his abode as your own home, do not be afraid to speak the truth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જાઓ આ ગામની મેલી આશ<RHYME_208817>, એમ કહે જમને અવિનાશ<RHYME_208817>; 
તે માણશિયે સર્વે સાંભળી, જેવી વીતી તેવી કહી વળી.
gujarati.context: Leave behind the warmth of this village's affection, as impermanent as it is; take it with you, just like how a passing thought disappears.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સુણી કહેવા લાગ્યા જન સહુ, આ તો પરચો થયો મોટો બહુ; 
વળી એ ગામમાં એક સઇ, નામ માવો તે સતસંગી નઈ.
gujarati.context: It seems that people are calling someone a big deal, but it's just a small person who has gained fame in their village and doesn't have a good reputation.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેના દેહનો આવિયો અંત<RHYME_208820>, કહું તેનું હવે વરતંત<RHYME_208820>; 
તેને લેવા આવ્યા જમ ત્રણ<RHYME_208821>, લીધો જીવ પામિયો મરણ<RHYME_208821>.
gujarati.context: The body's last breath is taken away, and I say farewell to it now; three things were taken from me, my life was spent in death itself.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જ્યારે જીવ લઈ જમ વળ્યા, ત્યારે સંતરૂપે સ્વામી મળ્યા; 
કહે જમ પ્રત્યે જન એમ<RHYME_208795>, એ જીવને લીધો તમે કેમ<RHYME_208795>.
gujarati.context: When the soul is taken away, then the Lord takes on a beautiful form; it asks the soul, "Why did you take this life from me?"
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે જમ એ કુસંગી સઇ, તેને જાશું જમપુરે લઈ; 
ત્યારે સંત કહે નહિ લેવાય<RHYME_208823>, તમે કરશો જો કોટિ ઉપાય<RHYME_208823>.
gujarati.context: I'll take away the "cursed" one to Jam's place; if you don't want it, then you can make a hundred ways for yourself.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એ તો કરે છે કામ અમારું, તેને તેડું ન જોઈએ તમારું; 
ત્યારે જમ કહે નથી તમારો,  શીદ એ જીવને લેતાં વારો.
gujarati.context: Someone else does our work, and we don't see their effort; when we're in trouble, there's no one to say "your fault". Our life is stolen away by others' wars.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એ જે કામ તમારું કરે છે, તે તો કોઈક થકી ડરે છે; 
ત્યારે સંત કહે સાચું કહ્યું, પણ સંતસેવા ફળ ગયું.
gujarati.context: "He who does your work is the one you fear; then a saint says, 'The truth has been spoken,' but reaps no reward."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે એ વાતમાં ખોટ્ય મોટી, જાઓ મેલી થાઓ શીદ ખોટી; 
પછી જમ ગયા ઝખ મારી, સંતે લીધો એ જીવ ઉગારી.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a great mistake made for the sake of love, which is now regretted and will only bring more suffering.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યો દેહ માંહિ માવો જ્યારે, વીતી વાત કહી સર્વે ત્યારે; 
પામ્યા આશ્ચર્ય સહુ સાંભળી, થયો પરચો કહે જન મળી.
gujarati.context: When the body is filled with worldly desires, one's words become mere empty talk; only when the heart is free from attachment does true wisdom emerge.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી એ ગામમાં સથવારો, નામ ત્રિકમ સતસંગી સારો; 
તેને આવ્યું ટુંટિયું અનાડી, પેશી તનમાં તાણી છે નાડી.
gujarati.context: In this village, I found true friends, three of them, who share a common name; they are so pure and genuine that my heart beats for them alone. Their presence is like a gentle breeze in my being, soothing my soul.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
હાથ પગ રગ લીધી તાણી, થયો પરવશ બોલી બંધાણી; 
પછી તરત જીવ તેનો કાઢી, ચાલ્યું ટુંટિયું તેહને પાડી.
gujarati.context: As the couple's bond was strengthened, their love grew wild; afterwards, they parted ways, leaving only memories behind.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે ત્રિકમે કર્યું સ્મરણ<RHYME_208821>, આવો નાથ હું પામિયો મરણ; 
એવું સુણી આવ્યા અવિનાશ<RHYME_208817>, સંગે ભક્ત માંચો વીરદાસ.
gujarati.context: When memories of the past are revived, I am filled with regret and longing for death; yet, my soul remains unbroken, singing praises to God, Vīradās.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે નાથ ટુંટિયાને એમ<RHYME_208795>, એહ જીવને લીધો તેં કેમ<RHYME_208795>; 
એ તો શરણ છે જો અમારે, તેને લેવા ન આવવું તારે.
gujarati.context: The speaker questions the purpose of life, wondering why they were given this fleeting existence. The answer lies in surrendering to God and not trying to control it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આ ગામમાં તારે નવ્ય ગરવું, જો તું ઇચ્છે મનમાં ઊગરવું; 
કાઢ્યું ટુંટિયું તગડી બાર<RHYME_208799>, વાલે કરી છે જનની વાર<RHYME_208799>.
gujarati.context: In this village, you should proudly show off your new possessions if you desire to boast in your mind; otherwise, the quarrel of the people is fierce and ongoing.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
મેલી ગયા ત્રિકમને નાથ<RHYME_208834>, તેડી ગયા ડોશી એક સાથ<RHYME_208834>; 
પછી ત્રિકમે તનમાં આવી, કરી વાત સહુને બોલાવી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Three friends got together, without any plan or design, and then one of them spoke up to share their thoughts with the others.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે મારે માથે બહુ થઈ<RHYME_208836>, મને ગયુંતું ટુંટિયું લઈ<RHYME_208836>; 
તેને હાથથી નાથે મુકાવી, મને મેલ્યો આ દેહમાં લાવી.
gujarati.context: A person's life is like a thread that has been spun, and it should be left at the end of one's journey without being entangled by others' hands. One should weave their own fate within their mortal body.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
મારે સાટે જશે પૂરીબાઈ, વાત સાચી માનો મન માંઇ; 
સુણી સહુ થયાં છે વિસમે, તજ્યું તન પૂરિયે તે સમે.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Believe what I say, it's true to my heart; my promise will be fulfilled, as it was spoken with sincerity.

(2 lines)
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 158: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
મળી વાત લાગી નહિ વાર<RHYME_208799>, પામ્યાં આશ્ચર્ય સહુ નરનાર્ય; 
કહે થયો પરચો આ મોટો, હશે પાપી તે પરઠશે ખોટો.

transliteration.context: The God Trikamne left with the sinful one together; afterwards, he returned to Trikamne's abode and bore the punishment.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe māre māthe bahu thaī, mane gayutu ṭunṭiyu laī; <RHYME_33>
Tene hāththī Nāthe mukāvī, mane melyo ā dehmā lāvī.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: A daughter-in-law is often oppressed by her mother-in-law, but she secretly brings happiness to her husband; meanwhile, the mother-in-law's efforts are futile and ultimately bring shame to herself.

transliteration.couplet:
Māre sāṭe jashe Pūrībāī, vāt sāchī māno man māi; <RHYME_34>
Suṇī sahu thayā chhe visame, tajyu tan Pūriye te same.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a woman named Puri Bai who is considered honest and truthful, with her thoughts aligning with her words. The speaker humbly seeks to emulate her example in their own life.

transliteration.couplet:
Maḷī vāt lāgī nahi vār, pāmyā āshcharya sahu nar-nārya; <RHYME_35>
Kahe thayo paracho ā moṭo, hashe pāpī te paraṭhashe khoṭo.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: The couplet says that a person who doesn't care about the world's opinion is truly astonishing, and such a person is beyond praise or blame. One should be like this, leaving worries behind, and not get entangled in petty issues.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī Gaḍhaḍe vaṇik ek, te to kuḷe sahit nāstik; <RHYME_36>
Kahe karma vaḍe sarva thāy, evu samajī rākhyu man māy.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: A merchant, Vaḷī Gaḍhaḍe, is an atheist who doesn't believe in the hereafter. He says that all actions are futile, and this worldly life is just an illusion to him.

transliteration.couplet:
Rām-Kṛuṣhṇa ādik avatār, teno paṇ nahi tene bhār; <RHYME_37>
Evo ḍhunḍhiye ḍhābarī pāḍyo, mokṣh mārag karme dekhāḍyo.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of the avatars (incarnations) of God, including Rama and Krishna, who are burdened with the responsibility to liberate humanity; one should thus tread the path of karma with devotion to achieve liberation.

transliteration.couplet:
Karyu pāpīe pāpīnu kām, ṭāḷī nākhyu bachārānu ṭhām; <RHYME_38>
Tyā to āviyo dehno kāḷ, āvyā teḍavā jam vikarāḷ.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: The pleasure of sinning is fleeting, but the fear of being punished by God stays forever. The brief joy of doing wrong is followed by eternal regret and punishment.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvī gherī līdho ghar māi, moṭā mudagar chhe karamāi; <RHYME_39>
Māro māro kare mukhavāṇ, kāḍho bārye kahe jamarāṇ.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context:
My mother's house is sweet and gentle, but my in-laws' place is full of troubles and arguments.
My mother-in-law is very harsh, she speaks loudly and argues with everyone.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Hīme haiyāmā vichārī, joyā ḍhunḍhiyā sarve sambhārī; <RHYME_40>
Paṇ koīthī kāj na saryu, tem tem jame jor karyu.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context:
In times of hardship, everyone thinks clearly and makes preparations; only a foolish person doesn't take precautions and rushes into things.

When there's no work to be done, one should not hurry or rush, but instead wait patiently for the right opportunity.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre thayo nirāshī atyant, pachhī sambhāryā Swāmī ne sant; <RHYME_41>
Karatā chintavaṇī chitta māi, āvyā sant ne Mahārāj tyāī.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: The soul is extremely restless and troubled, but then it finds peace with the Lord's guidance. The Lord's mercy brings relief to a worried mind, just like a king shows compassion to his people.

transliteration.couplet:
Lāvyā lohnī geḍiyo hāthe, āvī māriyo jamne māthe; <RHYME_42>
Pāḍī rāḍya bhāgyā jamarāṇ, dīṭhā Hīme te prakaṭ pramāṇ.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: Life's journey is like a rope tied to the tree of fate, with moments of joy and sorrow entwined. As we move forward, our path becomes clear, revealing its true measure in hindsight.

transliteration.couplet:
Pāmyo āshcharya paracho thayo, kene na kahyu samajī rahyo; <RHYME_43>
Thayu sukh sharīrmā jyāre, karī vāt vistārīne tyāre.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The unexpected event has passed, but the mind remains bewildered and unable to comprehend; one's body enjoys bliss and the breath spreads freely.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe pāmyo hu paracho moṭo, āpaṇo mat mānajyo khoṭo; <RHYME_44>
Jo na kare Swāmī sant vār, to hu marat khāi khāi mār.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: One is often misled by their own ego, but doesn't realize the harm it causes; if one doesn't follow God's will, they will be consumed by their own desires and suffer.

transliteration.couplet:
Me dīṭhu najare mot māru, pāmyo dukh hu shu shu sambhāru; <RHYME_45>
Āpaṇāmā kāī na ūghaḍyu, kharā khoṭānu pārakhyu paḍyu.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: Life's troubles will exhaust me, I'll cry out in despair; But still, my own foolishness will lead to more pain and suffering.

transliteration.couplet:
Have jyā lagī raheshe ā tan, karīsh Mahārājnu bhajan; <RHYME_46>
Em parchāno nahi āve pār, thāy hammesh hajāro-hajār.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: The divine love has taken residence within me, and I am engaged in the worship of Mahārāj (God). Like a boat on the river, I am carried by the waves of fate without being able to control my destiny.

transliteration.couplet:
Ketā ketā kiyā lagī kahīe, aparmano pār na lahīye; <RHYME_47>
Āge parachā kavie kahyā, te to ṭhīk eṭalā ja thayā.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: Don't hastily take a step that you might regret later, for it's better to pause and think carefully first. Think wisely before making a decision, so you don't face trouble afterwards.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṇ ājno ant na āve, mar koṭi kavi maḷī gāve; <RHYME_48>
Me kahyu vichārī man māi, nathī karato hu vāt vaḍāī.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should not waste their time and energy on someone who doesn't appreciate them, just like a cow would not milk a tree. It cautions against wasting emotions on someone unresponsive or uncaring.

transliteration.couplet:
Jem chhe tem kahyu me jan, satya mānajyo māru vachan; <RHYME_49>
Hashe satyavādī sant jeh, satya mānashe manmā teh.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The truth is known to those who seek it within themselves, and false statements can be exposed by wise people's words.

transliteration.couplet:
Hashe duṣhṭ dambhī ne nāstik, kaheshe khoṭī khānchyo khoḷī chhek; <RHYME_50>
Te to bhogavashe faḷ tenu, nathī Niṣhkuḷānandne enu.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: A boastful non-believer is like a worthless, foolish chatterbox; their words are but a mere whisper in the wind. Their desires may be fulfilled for a moment, but ultimately they will experience sorrow and pain.
